text: So, we said that LO and LA and LOS and LAS become LE and LES.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: The four options of LO, LA, LOS, LAS become LE and LES, when it's to him, to her, for him, for her.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And we said that ME, TE and NOS, they don't change to get these different meanings.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And we also saw that these words, ME, TE and NOS, can mean myself, yourself, ourselves or each other.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, how would you say, I speak to myself?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Although, of course, the more natural meaning you would probably understand from Nos hablamos is we speak to each other, as NOS also means each other.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Now, to get the meaning of himself, herself, themselves, LO and LA and LOS and LAS become SE, which is very easy to remember because it's the beginning of self.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So when we want this meaning of self or selves, we get SE.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So, to recap, ME, TE and NOS, they already have the meanings included of myself, yourself, ourselves, each other.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: But these ones that change, these small words that change, LO, LA, LOS and LAS, to get the meaning of himself, herself, themselves, it's going to be SE.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: You could say the word for he.

text: What is the word for he?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: She speaks to herself and clarify, use the word for she.

text: So here we are not using SE.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: For ME, TE and NOS, we have all of the meanings included in ME, TE and NOS.

text: Tell me again, how is they speak?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Now a different them, not themselves.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: This group is speaking to another group.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So now we can go back to a verb like to stay.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So to get the meaning of stay, you say I remain myself.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: We remain ourselves, so we stay.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And you stay, talking informally, you remain yourself.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Let's just practice the words for emphasis as well.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So you could say I am staying.

text: What is the word for I?

text: What was the word for we?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So we have nosotros for we.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: How would you say we are staying, we are remaining ourselves?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And if you are an all-female group, nosotros will change.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Nosotras nos quedamos if you are all-female group.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: What is the word for you in the sense of if we want to clarify or emphasize you are staying, speaking informally?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So how would you say you are staying, emphasizing that we mean you?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So these were the versions actually we were practicing before with me, te and nos.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: We didn't look at he stays, because actually what we needed to say he stays is he remains himself.

text: And we didn't have that yet, but now we do.

speaker: Speaker 1

text: The e of querer splits when we put the stress on it.

text: Now if you want to say I want to stay, you say I want to remain myself.

text: He wants to remain himself or she wants to remain herself?

text: And we said that whilst usted is formal, ustedes, the plural you, is not necessarily formal.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Quedarse is the version of the verb that you're going to find in the dictionary.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So in the dictionary, you will find quedar and all of the different meanings of quedar, which is remain, and the various other meanings actually this verb has can be used like to fit.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And then you will find the next entry, quedarse.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And then you will find next to it to stay.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So when this reflexive, when this doing it to oneself carries a different meaning, it will get a different entry in the dictionary.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And it's not going to be in the dictionary as quedarme or quedarte or quedarnos, but quedarse.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Because this se is also like oneself.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So in the dictionary, what you find is to remain oneself.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: The se is written like one word.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Whenever we put se, lo, me, te, nos, one of these small words, at the end of the two form, it's written like one word.

text: Let's practice this just with one more verb.
